citations.title: Prefer de-identified data: HIPAA describes two paths—Safe Harbor (removal of 18 identifiers) and Expert Determination; properly de‑identified data are not PHI under HIPAA [HHS De‑identification Guidance]( If you’re in the UK, see the NHS Anonymisation Standard (ISB1523) for publishing health data [NHS ISB1523](https://digital.nhs.uk/data-and-information/information-standards/information-standards-and-data-collections-including-extractions/publications-and-notifications/standards-and-collections/isb1523-anonymisation-standard-for-publishing-health-and-social-care-data).

Prefer de-identified data: HIPAA describes two paths—Safe Harbor (removal of 18 identifiers) and Expert Determination; properly de‑identified data are not PHI under HIPAA [HHS De‑identification Guidance](https://www.hhs.gov/hipaa/for-professionals/privacy/special-topics/de-identification/index.html). If you’re in the UK, see the NHS Anonymisation Standard (ISB1523) for publishing health data [NHS ISB1523](

Use public, credentialed resources: PhysioNet’s MIMIC‑IV is de‑identified and free for research after a short training and data use agreement; it’s widely used and well-documented [Johnson et al., 2023, Nature Sci Data](
Start with synthetic data when possible: Synthea generates realistic, fully synthetic EHRs you can use without PHI risk for modeling and pipeline prototyping [Walonoski et al., 2020](
Why: DP bounds individual influence and is a standard approach for privacy‑preserving learning in healthcare [Survey: Differential Privacy for Medical Data](
Why: FL addresses data locality and governance constraints by decentralizing training; it’s active in medical imaging and EHR research [Survey: Federated Learning for Medical Image Analysis](
HHS — Guidance on De‑identification of Protected Health Information
NHS Digital — ISB1523: Anonymisation Standard for Publishing Health and Social Care Data
Johnson et al., 2023 — MIMIC‑IV, a freely accessible electronic health record dataset
Walonoski et al., 2020 — Synthea: An approach, method, and software mechanism for generating synthetic patients
Sheller et al., 2023 (survey) — Federated Learning for Medical Image Analysis: A Survey
Almansoori et al., 2023 (survey) — A Survey on Differential Privacy for Medical Data Analysis

It offers specific, actionable strategies for beginners, such as using de-identified or synthetic datasets, following privacy guidance, and choosing small, falsifiable studies. The response explicitly pairs multiple privacy risks with specific mitigation strategies: risk of handling identifiable patient data is mitigated by using de-identified datasets (HIPAA Safe Harbor, Expert Determination) and synthetic data (Synthea); risk of re-identification is mitigated by avoiding re-identification attempts and using credentialed resources (MIMIC-IV with DUA); risk of data exposure is mitigated through differential privacy (DP-SGD with ε ≤ 5) and federated learning (FedAvg without raw data sharing); and risk of tool failure is mitigated by testing de-identification pipelines on synthetic notes. Each risk is addressed with concrete technical and procedural safeguards.

All proposed experiments are designed to be falsifiable and privacy-safe, directly addressing risks without real PHI exposure.","confidence":"high"}
judges.rationale: The agent's response identifies key privacy risks in healthcare AI research, such as handling protected health information (PHI), re-identification attempts, data sharing via unvetted services, and potential leaks from clinical text, and pairs them explicitly with mitigation strategies including the use of de-identified or synthetic datasets (e.g., MIMIC-IV, Synthea), adherence to HIPAA Safe Harbor/Expert Determination and NHS standards, implementation of privacy-preserving techniques like differential privacy (DP) and federated learning (FL), avoidance of raw data movement, rigorous documentation (e.g., Model Cards), and credentialing processes. All proposed experiments are designed to be falsifiable and privacy-safe, directly addressing risks without real PHI exposure.
